topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a6a499636872279200064d#post_55a6a499636872279200064d
its not length thats my issue its that most VGM isnt very interesting outside of the game itself, Video Game music is mostly meant to enhance the atmosphere and honestly i feel there isnt much point in listening to it on a regular basis without it enhancing the feel of something since thats its main purpose, also doesnt help that i barely even play video games.

i dig the Vib Ribbon OST because it doesnt get boring when you take it out of its own purpose and i really enjoy how the album has a very poppy sound but still manages to incorporate interesting dynamics and odd samples that feel quite experimental, theres more to it than just background for a video game.

"@SuperSupermario24":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a6a62d6368727e4a001cfe#post_55a6a62d6368727e4a001cfe
the touhou OST is overly generic in my opinion, ive heard plenty of the electronic and metal songs to come from it and every single one was worshiping the cliches of the genres, there isnt a single touhou song that didnt make me say "wow how generic could you possibly get?", if it works for you thats fine, but please do keep that specific soundtrack as far away from my ears as possible.
